Message.Title: Fire! (Part I)
Message.Msg: An analogy, to use a simile, is like a dangerous weapon, a truth never more evident than when presenting one to easily-excitable BAC message board members, many of who are perpetually celebrating their right to be as face-lessly stupid and whack as they want. Nevertheless, with the aim of eliciting even more of the critical thinking, logical problem resolution, and nuanced philosophical musings for which this board is famous, here you go, you state-of-the art, top-of-the-food-chain primates and logical geniuses, you: A crowd of neighbors are standing in front of a burning apartment building. They are arguing about which kind of arsonist is the most evil: the kind who use explosives; the kind who use blowtorches and accelerants; the kind who use BIC lighters and old newspaper, or the kind who use matches and a candle. The only thing they can agree upon is that this catastrophic blaze could only have resulted from arson (and horrors, it may have been two or more arsonists working in concert!!!). The discussion gains urgency as they focus on the definitions and exceptions for each category of arson: whether M-80's and Roman candles deserve patriotic exemptions; whether vodka is an accelerant; whether Zippos are as deadly as BICs; whether incense is a candle, and whether Japanese Perpetual Matches pose any threat whatsoever since they perpetually fail to ignite. Soon the neighbors are yelling at each other to be heard above the roar of the inferno and the screams of tenants still trapped inside. Flaming dogs and cats are racing out the front door of the building, and mothers and children are leaping from upper story windows and landing on tools and hoses and ladders and tools left by an irresponsible maintenance crew. Finally the fire department arrives, but can't gain access to the blaze due to the crowd, who by now, steadfastly refusing to be distracted from their citizen's crusade to classify arsonist and limit their selection of ignition sources.

Topic.Title: Liberals love to import terrorism through uncontrolled immigration

Topic.Title: Fire! (Part I)

Message.Msg: Fire! (Part II) have agreed to institute outright bans on dynamite, blowtorches, and Chechen vodka; gives old newspapers a pass since soon the only ones around will be so old they'll fall under existing statutes for archaeological artifacts; doubled penalties for using real estate flyers or other advertising materials as tinder; bars gas stations and propane dealers from selling lighters and Japanese Perpetual Matches unless local zoning waivers are granted; and allows candles except in high-powered, multi-chamber chambered infernal devices like menorahs and those dreadful banks of devotional candles often found in proximity to offerings boxes and holy water basins. The fire finally dies out; the injured and dead are removed from the scene, and the fire department departs. Suddenly, one of the neighbors shouts and points to flames coming from the adjacent apartment building, and screams in disbelief: "Oh my God, that's my building! Somebody DO something!" Proud of their success in putting out the first blaze, his neighbors race next door, quickly conclude that a serial arsonist is at large, and then begin to discuss which one of them should call the fire department. On the lawn in front of the now-smoking basement of the former apartment building, two survivors are having their own conversation: (#1): "Ralph! Thank God you're alive! Ain't we lucky to live in the best darned country in t the world? We're gonna be getting a brand-new apartment, and I'll bet the developers will have it up in under two weeks! (#2) "You said it, Norton! And we're covered by rent control, so they're never be able to raise our rent. How SWEEET it is!" Try applying this fire analogy to nuclear weapons, drones, explosives, guns, planes trains and automobiles, alcohol, and drugs, and see if you detect any pattern(s). ROTFLAMO

Topic.Title: Liberals love to import terrorism through uncontrolled immigration

Message.Msg: A little information on who Obama was "raised by" "Dunham studied at the East–West Center and at the University of Hawaii at Manoa in Honolulu, where she attained a bachelor's in anthropology or mathematics[3] and master's and Ph.D. in anthropology.[4] Interested in craftsmanship, weaving and the role of women in cottage industries, Dunham's research focused on women's work on the island of Java and blacksmithing in Indonesia. To address the problem of poverty in rural villages, she created microcredit programs while working as a consultant for the United States Agency for International Development. Dunham was also employed by the Ford Foundation in Jakarta and she consulted with the Asian Development Bank in Gujranwala, Pakistan. Towards the latter part of her life, she worked with Bank Rakyat Indonesia, where she helped apply her research to the largest microfinance program in the world.[4]"

Topic.Title: Funny not one peep out of the left on Posse Comitatus when the nilitary was used in the terrorist hunt in Boston, when obama is in office

Message.Msg: The only thing that Posse Comitatus prohibits is the use of military personal in law enforcement in common law states or although some states, such as Georgia, have repealed the Posse Comitatus provision in their state laws. Most states today are not common law states. For example only those nine states that still allow common law marriage are common law states (Alabama, Colorado, Kansas, Rhode Island, South Carolina, Iowa, Montana, Washington, Utah and Texas). All "law enforcement" against the two brothers was done by FBI, local, and state police. Please get your facts straight since it is clear you and little z don't have a clue about Posse Comitatus. But, if an actual insurrection ever occurred in the USA I'd bet that the Posse Comitatus would be ignored as the preservation of our nation is more important than the any conservative (or liberal) interpretation of the law.

Message.Msg: Under Kennedy, troop strength increased from 900 to 16,300 during his short presidency. Johnson took that number to 536,000 by 1968. Troop levels started dropping in 1969. Our interest in Indochina dates back to our policy of containment of the spread of communism. Hence Truman's commitment to help the French with less than 200 advisors. Eisenhower, too, followed the doctrine and supported the french with supplies and military assistance but no American troops were engaged in combat. I did not know about Lady Bird's far flung financial interests but it wouldn't surprise me.

Message.Msg: Lib, as someone else pointed out here, Since '46 the US had a policy of containing communism. Truman was the first president to assist the French in repelling communism in Viet Nam. Ike followed suit but no US troops engaged in combat. Under Kennedy and Johnson, troop strength lept from under 1000 to more than 1/2 million. Ergo, the dems "own" that war. The labor participation rate is the lowest it has been in 30 years. That is largely due to a policy of fostering the nanny state. You said it yourself, " long term unemployment benefits" discourages work. BTW, low taxes encourages work. High taxes discourages work. You've got it backwards. If the reps hadn't retaken the house in '11 one can only imagine what our deficits and debt would be under this fiscally challenged president's social agenda. Yes, deficits are less but that is due increased receipts because of a resilient of corporate America. Maybe the deficit will close below $1 trillion but it will still require borrowing abroad and that includes China.

Message.Title: This Week's Big Winner
Message.Msg: CCUR is probably the most undervalued stock with the biggest upside potential on the NASDAQ. Its only $6.66 with 8.72mm shares outstanding and a market cap of $58mm. It has $24.6mm in cash and no debt. Enterprise value is only $33.5mm or just 0.53X its trailing revenues of $63mm. Their 2Q 2013 EPS was up 100% from 1Q 2013 and their 1Q 2013 EPS was up 100% from 4Q 2012. Their 3Q 2013 EPS is due out very soon! If you watch video on demand using your cable TV service and subscribe to Time Warner Cable, Cox, Charter, or Bright House, CCUR provides your VOD service and they just signed another unnamed top 5 North American pay-TV company! CCUR also just signed a huge multi-screen TV deal with Virgin Media (VMED) the largest cable TV company in the UK. Their EPS is likely to continue exploding in the quarters ahead and the stock could quickly double or triple!

Topic.Title: Hitch

Message.Msg: Lib, I guess you could ask the same question of anyone that sees things differently than you do in the sociopolitical landscape. I tend to react, not crusade. I don't think I have ever initiated a political dialogue here. If I seem to have become more caustic and entrenched it is because I am responding to comments from the left which are sweeping generalizations or gross misrepresentations Few people appreciate the continuum of events like the slow involvement in Nam that started with HST. Or take the inane comment, "The GOP owns 9/11." Should we forget that in 1998 the head of the CIA's counter intelligence unit informed Clinton of a plot brewing? Sure it happened on Bush's watch but could Clinton have been more vigilant? An your comment that the GOP owns every afterwards was a sweeping generalization. Who do you think controlled the Whitehouse and congress in '09 - '10 when much of the groundwork for our economic funk was laid admist a massive build up in debt and deficits? On BAC, I don't own the stock. I sold 9/08 after having owned it since '91. But I still watch it. When someone here asks an honest question about the stock I'll try to answer it if no one else does. BAC is still mired in litigation. More troublesome is its growth prospects are unclear, particularly given Q1 revenue drop. Too, the new regs are about to hit the industry biggies. All considered they will need those reserves. But clearly, BAC is a better company now that it was a few years ago. It's a value play but without the dividend income.
